div.p:
I have this moment received
Sir Samuel's Opinion, it might easily be
conceived what it would be from what we
have previously known - I shall not copy
all that he says only give you the sum
of all -

All the estates are subject to the
Term of ten years. -

The annuities & immediate legacies
to be paid out of the rents -

I have discovered a thing favorable to
myself which is that the Lands settled on
my mother at the time of her marriage
are not liable to the ten years trustees

Notwithstanding all this my Dear
B. my difficulties are tremendous
& if I had to do with any other
than Mrs E I believe I should be in
in despair
Whether the trustees act or not Her trusts
must be executed - I must confess however
that I had rather have all the responsibility
on my own shoulders than be accountable
to Trustees -
" The Interest of the Legacies given to
the Children who are infants can not be paid
to any person for their use during their
Infancy, but a sufficient sum out of the
interest may be applied during their infancy
for their maintenance & education, The rest
of the interest must accumulate for their
benefit till they are of age " -

And now you are as wise as I am
what steps to follow I dont exactly know
I believe however one thing: that nothing
will persuade me from deviating from
what I think to be right, & from doing what
I hope may tend to the happiness of the
family which has unfortunately been
entrusted to my care
div.closer:
- Adieu Compts to your AB
from Lovell E
